original_title: Sri Lanka’s main inflation eases to 22.1 pct
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s broader National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) is 22.1 percent in May on a year-on-year (YoY) compared to 33.2 percent a month ago, data from the Department of Census and Statistics showed.
The food inflation also eased in tandem with the main index to 15.8 percent from 27.1 percent in April.
While non-food inflation declined to 27.6 percent from 39 percent.

Prices of some essential goods have decreased in the past two months as Sri Lanka’s rupee started to appreciate against the US dollar and other major currencies, the rupee has appreciated around 20 percent so far this year. (Colombo/June21/2023)
